channel.title: Keydown with CNTRL and V - how to do it

item.title: Keydown with CNTRL and V - how to do it
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

[quote=“anewguy1, post:1, topic:442192”]Hi, Simba NOOB here

I want to use CNTRL V to paste something using my script. I can make the KeyDown work with one key and I thought that if I used 2 KeyDown sequences I could get CNTRL V working.

The code below does not perform the windows paste function. I have verified that I do have something on my windows clip board to paste. Any help would be appreciated

KeyDown(17); Wait(50); KeyDown(56); Wait(50); KeyUp(56); Wait(50); KeyUp(17);[/quote]

V is 86. Just use the VK_XXX constants instead of the numbers.

KeyDown(VK_CONTROL); Wait(50); KeyDown(VK_V); Wait(50); KeyUp(VK_V); Wait(50); KeyUp(VK_CONTROL)

Read full topic
item.source: Keydown with CNTRL and V - how to do it
